programmes.show_description: Ashes To Ashes. Kelly lives in an 18th century cottage on the edge of the Forest of Dean. Is an evil paranormal force causing Kelly's daughter to experience mysterious mood swings? S3, Ep9
Playing With The Devil. The team are called to investigate a 17th century pub. The landlord is petrified to enter the attic and believes a sinister spirit resides there. S3, Ep10
Teleshopping.
No Stone Unturned. In Seaton, Drew dashes under a staircase for a pair of floodlights. In Yorkshire, he uses a penknife to see if a newly upholstered chair hides a valuable original. S11, Ep7
Family. Drew bargains hard in Frome, Somerset. And in Dumfriesshire, he's at an estate that's been in the same family for several generations and is full of fascinating antiques. S11, Ep8
A family of five is relocating to the USA. They're looking for a modern-style four-bedroom house in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for a budget of around £500,000. S2, Ep6

Prospective buyers around the UK wanting to swap hectic city living for a home in the country are shown an array of beautiful rural properties. S18, Ep56
Clearances. Drew visits a dealer specialising in house clearances. In Sheffield, he spots industrial furniture at a 19th century factory plus he finds old punk collectables. S11, Ep10
Treasure Hunt. At an antiques centre in Gloucestershire, Drew finds a valuable item overlooked by the rest of the trade. Later, he digs out lost treasures on a Kent country estate. S11, Ep11
Eccentric People. In the Lake District, Drew meets an alpaca keeper and antiques collector fond of the unusual. And, at a Staffordshire castle, he meets an Elizabeth I lookalike. S11, Ep12
Charles Hanson and Catherine Southon continue their trip as they scour Kent for antiques. Charles finds a pair of rare 18th-century shoe buckles he thinks may turn a profit. S14, Ep2
Charles Hanson and Catherine Southon resume their trip in Warwickshire. Catherine finds a French copper and brass letter holder and Charles grabs a charming oak chair. S14, Ep3
A pair of brothers bring in a Raleigh Chopper bike they got as a Christmas present in 1975. Plus, an elderly woman brings in her childhood teddy bear for restoration. S5, Ep59
Angus explores Boyzone star Shane Lynch's super-cars and a camper-van-turned-mini-bar. Then he checks out presenter Julia Bradbury's Victorian chair. S4, Ep4

programmes.show_name: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programmes.show_description: A man left on a stranger's doorstep uncovers a painful family secret. A woman learns why she was left in the back of an Aston Martin car in the 1950s. S5, Ep2

programmes.show_name: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programmes.show_description: Davina and Nicky catch up with three searchers desperate to find their parents, including John, who was reunited with his birth mother after 50 years. S7, Ep1
Sarah Moore saves three items from the dump and transforms them into valuable pieces. She then sells them and returns the profits to those who ditched them. S9, Ep14
Different Is Good. Drew and Alister are on the hunt for exciting stock. They visit a business specialising in the creation of artificial flowers for film and theatre. S18, Ep11
Steven Moore and Angus Ashworth scour the town of Belper for interesting antiques. Plus, Angus visits one of the oldest underwear factories in the world. S20, Ep14
Last Chance Saloon. The investigation at the Rosedeer Hotel and Last Chance Saloon gets off to a chilling start when Jordyn is immediately is attacked by an unseen force. S2, Ep6
Never Dead And Buried. The team investigate unsettling activity at the Trinity Arts Centre. Box Office Manager Lisa has worked there for 20 years and fears going into certain rooms. S3, Ep11
Bargain To Burden. The team investigate a home in the former mining village of Ynyshir. Can they identify a menacing spirit and finally bring peace to this property? S3, Ep12
Devil In Disguise. In Peterborough, a sinister entity drags Kevin out of bed and leaves him with painful scratches. The team conduct an intense investigation to uncover the demon. S4, Ep1
The Curse Of The Jinn. When a dark figure tortures Asha, her daughter believes a curse has been inflicted. The team take on their toughest case yet as they try to banish the entity. S4, Ep2
Teleshopping.

A couple is looking to trade the open countryside for a life by the sea in Suffolk. They want a three-bedroom property with a courtyard garden for a budget of around £400,000. S2, Ep7

Drew and Tee are on an incredible tour of France. In Normandy, Drew falls in love with a grand chateau and at a massive antique fair he immerses himself in pop culture. S14, Ep1
Drew and Tee are on a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they explore a grand country house. S14, Ep2
Drew is in Lancashire, checking out a factory making traditional soap. And, in rural Dorset he visits a couple selling antiques from a manor house linked to the Churchill family. S14, Ep3
Charles Hanson and Catherine Southon embark on the penultimate leg of their trip. Charles goes to work with a metal detector while Catherine sticks to antiques stores. S14, Ep4
Charles Hanson and Catherine Southon begin the final leg of their trip. Charles finds a collection of railwayana before the auction in Congleton. S14, Ep5
Ceramicist Kirsten repairs a set of clay sculptures. Metal expert Dominic rejuvenates a vintage lawnmower and leather expert Suzie revives a toy horse. S6, Ep1
Dominic Littlewood & Lisa George. In Dom Littlewood's stylish seaside pad, Angus finds a rare guitar. Then, he checks out 1950s treasures at soap star Lisa George's home. S4, Ep5

programmes.show_description: A police detective left on church steps discovers the truth about his own identity. A woman left in a hospital in the 1960s gets surprising news. S5, Ep3

programmes.show_name: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programmes.show_description: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell catch up with Yasika, who searched for her Sri Lankan mother, and Paula, who explored her Native American heritage. S7, Ep2
Jay Blades rescues two rusty metal gates, a set of mid-century chairs and two tables from a skip in Walsall. Can these discarded items be transformed into profit? S9, Ep15
Conversation Starters. Drew and Alister's hunt for pieces with an interesting backstory takes them from Sussex to Shropshire with campaign furniture and quirky collectables. S18, Ep13
Antiques experts Angus Ashworth and Steven Moore embark on the last leg of their road trip. Who will be victorious at the final auction in Dundee? S20, Ep15
Fix This Home In 24 Hours. Dave and Jenny surprise a family in Tulsa with a 24-hour makeover and full home refresh for their young daughter battling cancer. S7, Ep7
A 'New' New Jersey. After receiving a life-changing inheritance, David helps a New Jersey native return to his home state and find his forever home. S18, Ep9
Big Bucks In Boca Raton. With a few windfalls in their pockets, a couple calls on David Bromstad yet again to find their third dream home in Boca Raton, Florida. S18, Ep10
Unfinished Business. The Old Vicarage has terrifying reports of paranormal activity. With 800 years of history attached to the hotel, will the team be able to identify the spirits? S4, Ep3
